title: Plengkung Beach
text: G-Land My experience from home to Plengkung. The distance from my house to Plengkung Beach is quite far, because my house is in Ringinagung Pesanggaran, my journey is quite tiring and the access to get there is quite good because most of the roads are already paved, and the entrance ticket is quite expensive for villagers like me (25k per person). And when I arrived there, it turns out that it's not just Plengkung Beach, but there is also Sadengan savanna, Plengkung Beach and many other beaches. Plengkung Beach is quite clean and comfortable. And for children, they can play in the small river near the beach. The waves on the beach are quite brave so no one plays in the water, and there are also many gazebos for visitors to rest, and there are many monkeys, and as long as we don't disturb the monkeys, they won't disturb us. The downside there is not many children's games like swings or others so children get bored quickly because most visitors bring children. And also there are no signposts to indicate where the place is and how far it is. That's all my experience at Plengkung Beach. Thank you.

title: Plengkung Beach
text:
G-Land Here is one of the points of the Triangle Diamond of Banyuwangi. Plengkung Beach, a beach with waves rumored to be the second largest in the world. For those of you who are not yet skilled at conquering waves, don't try it, it's better to conquer the heart of your future in-laws first.
The Terrace Limestone of Blambangan Peninsula at Plengkung Beach in the southern part of Alas Purwo National Park, on the Blambangan Peninsula, reveals light brown-colored limestone rocks with a large amount of mollusk shells and coral fragments. While sand-sized limestone (calcarenite) contains planktonic and benthic foraminifera.
This limestone is a constituent of the karst landscape in the Blambangan Peninsula dating back to the Neogene, known as the Punung Formation. The karstification process on the surface of the limestone rock forms lapies or karren structures. Abrasion on the limestone cliffs produces sea-level notches with heights between 1.5-2 m above sea level on average. In the distance, to the north, three rows of beach terraces can be observed.
The presence of these beach terraces indicates the continued tectonic uplift activity in the southern part of Java Island. Plengkung Beach in the Banyuwangi area is known for its high-layered waves, making it a very famous international surfing location. Lava beneath the limestone terrace, volcanic mountains in the north formed on the mainland.

title: Plengkung Beach
text: G-Land Plengkung Beach is a beach located in the southern part of Banyuwangi regency. The supporting beach itself includes the area of Alas Purwo which is famous for its spookiness throughout Indonesia. Many people from inside and outside the city come for various purposes. Starting from wanting to travel with family to those who come for other purposes such as wanting to meditate and seek spirits. For its beauty, there is no doubt, that Plengkung beach or famous as G-Land has its own beauty and uniqueness. Its very high and big waves make it crowned as the second highest wave in the world under the waves of Hawaii beach in America so many surfers come from abroad and within the country to feel the greatness and fierceness of the waves of Plengkung beach. Not only the waves, the beach itself is very beautiful with its white sand adding to the beauty of Plengkung beach, so from that, Plengkung beach is one of the must-visit tourist destinations when vacationing in Banyuwangi. When you come to Banyuwangi, it doesn't feel complete, if you don't visit this one beach because it is famous throughout the country and abroad here we can also enjoy the journey while seeing the greenery of bamboo trees lining the side of the road which makes the journey more enjoyable and not boring.

title: Plengkung Beach
text: G-Land Plengkung Beach is located within the Alas Purwo National Park area. To get to this beach, you have to rent a vehicle from Pancur Beach for 250,000 IDR for a journey of about 9km. It's best to visit this beach from March to September because the waves are big and it becomes crowded with tourists who want to surf.

title: Plengkung Beach
text: G-Land Mentioning the name Plengkung or G-Land, almost everyone knows about it. Plengkung is a beach that has good waves and is suitable for surfers. Due to this uniqueness, Plengkung also hosts competitions that are attended by surfers from around the world. Surfers are challenged to conquer and enjoy the rolling waves at Plengkung. Plengkung is located within the Alas Purwo National Park area, and it takes about 3 hours to reach it from Banyuwangi city. Before reaching Plengkung, you will enter the Alas Purwo National Park, and about 5km later, you will arrive at Pancur Beach. The road from Alas Purwo National Park to Pancur is smooth asphalt that can be traveled by bicycles, motorcycles, cars, Hiace, buses, and trucks. Along the way, you will be treated to lush tree views that produce fresh air, and local residents' plantations. After reaching Pancur, you cannot go directly to Plengkung. To get to Plengkung, you have to take a Jeep provided by the Alas Purwo TN manager. The road from Pancur to Plengkung is a macadam road, and some parts are narrow, accompanied by dense trees and bushes, and interspersed with the sound of waves crashing in the distance. Why do you need to use the provided Jeep to get to Plengkung? Because, in addition to the road access being not good, there are sometimes monkeys, deer, and bulls that come out onto the road along the way. The Jeep fare starts at 250,000 IDR. Plengkung also has facilities such as gazebos, swings, helipads, and several cottages. Prepare enough food and drink supplies if you go to Plengkung, although there is also a clean and tidy food court in Pancur. Please visit Alas Purwo TN, and keep the environment clean and preserve nature.

title: Plengkung Beach
text: G-Land January 2020, Plengkung/G-Land beach is famous for its waves, a paradise for surfers, and one of the 7 best waves in the world. Besides surfing, visitors can enjoy other tourist attractions, there are 3 alternative beaches, 5 resorts, and 2 ways to visit there. Located in the Alas Purwo National Park: 1. Pura Luhur Giri Salaka, 2. Pura Kawitan (Kawitan site), 3. Savana Sadengan, 4. Pancur Post (Pancur beach, 24-hour food court, rest area, camping ground) electricity is available, 5. Istana Cave, 6. Mayangkara Cave, 7. Parangireng Beach, 8. Plengkung Beach. These sites are on the same route. If traveling by land from Banyuwangi city, turn left at De Djawatan and follow the directions to Alas Purwo, there are still 2 more gas stations. If traveling by sea, you can rent a boat from Muncar Beach or Bali. Always keep the environment clean and be polite.

title: Plengkung Beach
text: G-Land Another interesting beach tourist spot in Banyuwangi is Plengkung Beach or also called G-Land. For those of you who like to surf, this is the place. This beach is very famous with the enormity of rolling waves.  Tourists from various regions and countries come here to enjoy surfing at The Seven Giant Waves Wonder. This nickname is given because the waves on the beach are in the form of seven large scrolls with a height reaching 6 meters. The waves on this beach are also referred to as the second best wave in the world after the waves in Hawaii.  The best time to surf on Plengkung Beach is between July and September, although the waves here are good all year long. If you don't bring surfing equipment, you can rent it here, so there's no need to bother bringing it from home.  If you are not interested in surfing, there is no need to worry. Quiet atmosphere and away from the crowds make this tourist spot suitable for those of you who want a quality vacation. There is a tropical forest that surrounds the beach, you can do trekking and visit waterfalls in the forest. Plengkung Beach and its surroundings will not disappoint you.  ===========  Satu lagi tempat wisata pantai yang menarik di Banyuwangi adalah Pantai Plengkung atau yang juga disebut dengan G-Land. Bagi anda yang hobi berselancar, disinilah tempatnya. Pantai ini sangat terkenal dengan dahsyatnya ombak yang menggulung-gulung.  Wisatawan dari berbagai daerah dan negara datang kesini untuk menikmati surfing di The Seven Giant Waves Wonder ini. Julukan ini diberikan karena ombak di pantai ini berbentuk tujuh gulungan besar dengan ketinggian mencapai 6 meter. Ombak di pantai ini juga disebut sebagai ombak terbaik kedua di dunia setelah ombak di Hawaii.  Saat terbaik untuk berselancar di Pantai Plengkung adalah antara bulan Juli – September, meskipun ombak di sini bagus sepanjang tahun. Jika tak membawa perlengkapan selancar, Anda bisa menyewanya di sini, jadi tak perlu repot membawanya dari rumah.  Jika Anda kurang tertarik dengan kegiatan berselancar, tak perlu khawatir. Suasana tenang dan jauh dari keramaian membuat tempat wisata ini cocok bagi Anda yang mendamba liburan yang berkualitas. Terdapat hutan tropis yang mengelilingi pantai, Anda bisa melakukan trekking dan mengunjungi air terjun yang ada di dalam hutan. Pantai Plengkung dan sekitarnya tak akan mengecewakan Anda.

title: Plengkung Beach
text: G-Land As a country famous for having one of the longest coastlines in the world, Indonesia has many beautiful beaches. Their beauty is even popular overseas, one of which is Plengkung Beach in Banyuwangi, located in the southeastern part of Java Island. The beach, popularly known as G-Land, faces the Indian Ocean directly, so this beach has fairly large waves. The waves at Plengkung Beach are long, high, and have high speed. In addition, the waves at Plengkung Beach also roll into almost perfect wave tubes, making it a favorite among surfing enthusiasts. In 1972, a group of American surfers organized an expedition to Plengkung. This expedition was followed by 8 groups of surfers. Three of them departed with rented boats, while 5 other groups took the land route. The land group traveled until they arrived at Grajagan Village. From Grajagan, they traveled 20 kilometers to reach Plengkung by following the coastal waters using surfboards. After a tough journey and a shortage of clean water (which they collected during rain and the rainwater stuck to the boat's sail), the group using rented boats landed directly at Plengkung. Shortly after arriving, they set up a base camp to survey the surfing spots. They stayed at Plengkung for 10 days. A surfer named Mike Boyum helped establish the first surf camp at Plengkung. This surf camp was eventually taken over by a Balinese surfer named Bobby Radiasa in the late '70s and continues to this day. Inspired by the surf camp owned by Boyum/Bobby, other surf camps started opening in Plengkung. Among them are G-Land Bobby's Surf Camp which offers complete accommodations and facilities at relatively affordable rates. Additionally, there are Joyo's Surf Camp and G-Land Surf Camp.

title: Plengkung Beach
text: G-Land Pantai Plengkung Alias G-land, Tempat Berselancar Kelas Dunia Salah satu pantai di Banyuwangi yang popularitasnya sudah mendunia adalah Pantai Plengkung. Hal ini karena Pantai Plengkung yang terletak di Taman Nasional Alas Purwo ini, memiliki ombak yang sangat tinggi dan besar, sehingga banyak mengundang minat para peselancar tingkat dunia untuk menaklukkannya.  Pantai Plengkung diakui sebagai spot surfing terbaik di Asia Tenggara dan ombaknya termasuk satu dari tujuh ombak terbaik di dunia. Ombak di tempat ini sungguh besar dan konsisten merupakan hasil pengaruh arus Antartika, yang terbawa oleh Samudera Hindia. Dengan sudut teluk yang tepat, ombak yang dihasilkan adalah sempurna. Ketinggian ombaknya konon bisa mencapai 4-8 meter dengan panjang 2 km, serta memiliki formasi gelombang tujuh bersusun, sangat menantang bagi pecinta surfing untuk mencobanya.  Ombak di pantai ini dibagi menjadi 3 tingkatan yaitu Kong Waves (tinggi ombak mencapai 6-8 meter), Speedis Waves (5-6 m), dan Many Track Waves (3-4 m). Ombak tingkat terakhir (many track) biasanya digunakan para peselancar pemula untuk mengasah skill mereka.  Selain di Pantai Plengkung, ombak sebesar itu hanya ada di Hawai dan Afrika Selatan. Dan puncak kedatangan ombak terjadi pada April hingga Agustus setiap tahunnya. Di pantai  ini pernah diadakan lomba selancar internasional Quicksilver Pro Surfing Championship pada tahun '95, '96, dan '97 serta Da Hui Pro Surfing World Championship seri III tahun ‘2003. Dengan potensi yang dimilikinya, tak pelak lagi Pantai Plengkung pun dikenal sebagai surga bagi para peselancar professional.  Pantai Plengkung yang berhadapan langsung dengan Samudera Hindia dan berlokasi di timur Teluk Grajagan ini begitu digemari para peselancar yang pada umumnya berasal dari luar negeri. Tidak mengherankan jika Pantai Plengkung lebih populer di mancanegara daripada dalam negeri. Mayoritas wisatawan justru datang dari Amerika, Brasil atau Australia. Dari para peselancar asing yang mengagumi keindahan gulungan ombak di Pantai Plengkung inilah kemudian muncul sebutan G-Land bagi Pantai Plengkung. Sehingga bagi turis asing, mereka lebih mengenal G-Land daripada Pantai Plengkung.  Darimana asal-usul nama G-Land itu muncul? Di balik sebutan G-Land untuk Pantai Plengkung ternyata memiliki banyak versi. Huruf “G” pada G-Land ternyata merupakan singkatan dari beberapa hal, yaitu :  Dari kata “Grajagan” yang merupakan nama sebuah teluk, yaitu Teluk Grajagan. Diambil dari kata “Green” karena letaknya di tepi hutan tropis yang hijau. Lingkungan di sekitar Pantai Plengkung merupakan green forest, karena letaknya dikelilingi hamparan hutan pantai tropis dan hutan dataran rendah yang masih asri, maka jika dilihat dan diabadikan dalam foto dari jarak jauh, maka akan nampak berwarna kehijauan. Diambil dari kata “Great” karena ombaknya yang begitu besar, panjang dan penuh tantangan. Ada juga yang menyebutkan, Plengkung disebut G-Land karena pantainya melengkung mirip huruf G. Sebutan pantai Plengkung bagi penduduk lokal itu karena bentuk pantainya melengkung. Bila dilihat dari citra satelit, pantai ini bentuknya memang melengkung membentuk huruf G terbalik. Posisi dan letak pantainya itulah yang membuat ombak setinggi hingga 8 meter bisa terbentuk, yang membuatnya disukai para pecinta surfing.  Bagi yang hobi surfing maka G-Land atau Pantai Plengkung merupakan wisata yang wajib di kunjungi. Anda bisa mencoba belajar surfing kilat pada para mentor yang ada di sana. Namun jika anda tidak mempunyai hobi berselancarpun tetap saja pantai ini layak di kunjungi. Menyaksikan dari dekat para surfer yang sedang berselancar di tengah laut adalah sebuah pilihan yang menarik.

title: Surfer Heaven!!!
text: G-Land Indeed, you can't deny this beach has something the surfer need most, wave!  On August is the best for breaking into the wave. Very challenging! Good accessiblity by speed boat or chopper, but land transportation still become an issue. Just bring your surfing board which is supported by airlines now by giving a special handling into the airplane and airport.

title: Beautiful waves
text: G-Land This beach is a surfing beach, so dont get you hopes to play the water here up. There are a lot of foreigner here that come to try to surf in here, so there are also surfing camp here that provide if you want to stay for a night in here. I went to Joyo's surf camp lately, and it was alright. But you need to watch out for the monkey here, because they will try to steal your food.

title: The Surfing Spot
text: G-Land The most famous surfing spot in the east of java, a lots of nationality had visit this place on of the well known spot. The tastes way to reach this area through boat from Bali.

title: Heaven in The Middle of Nowhere
text:
G-Land This beach was superb! The wave is the best after Hawaii, they said. And I found it fascinating! You can find some of the 'camp' here, managed by their private owner. One camp consisted of some bungalow, maybe even cottage. They're full of lives, the living in a jungle kind-of-living style. I enjoyed my stay here, although I have to use mosquito net at night, torch-light to light up my path at night, wooden chairs, cold beer, and far from the city crowd!

Heaven for surfers!

title: Heaven for Surfers
text:
G-Land this place is the heaven for the surfers. unless you will only enjoy the high waves and see the surfers who are in action. Actually it is interesting but also boring.
It is expensive for local to stay there. Some areas were not really clean and well maintain.

title: Surfing and Sunset
text: G-Land G-Land is famous for surfing. It is also a great place for sunset. The Indian Ocean beckons landscape photographers as the sun sets.

title: Expensive for foreigners and dirty
text: G-Land The entry for foreigners to enter the park is 150,000 per day??  That's far too high a price when the roads and facilities are terrible and like other Indonesian national parks full of rubbish.   Then when you arrive 7km from the beach, you are not allowed to take your own motorbike down to the beach and have to pay 250,000rp for a private taxi.   I would suggest boycotting Indonesian national parks until they sort out their pricing and their facilities.

title: The best surf beach
text: G-Land This area is so peaceful and the surrounding natural setting , wonderful trees and plants . it is known for its top surf and many people from all around the world visit this spot. Sand is superb and the water so warm . on the way in you go through some fantastic old villages and easy to get to from the Bali Ferry or there is now a flight from Bali to within 30 klm or so .  A must if you surf or just sight seeing, unique.

title: Explore the nature
text:
G-Land Well, it tooks us more 4hrs drive to finally reach the beach known as GLand. 2.5 hours driving from Banyuwangi to arrive at the gate where you paid the pass to enter the national park. This beach one of the location in Alas purwo national part, the also have savana and other beaches that you could visit using your own car.
For the GLand its selves it still require 15 minutes to another gate where you park the car and report to jungle ranger your id and plan. And then you talk to Pak Komar as a coordinator to arrange your transportation to GLand (plengkung beach). You need to pay 250.000 idr for a car and a driver to drive and pick up for the return, they only have 6 cars where you need to wait until they retun from dropping other visitors. It takes 45mnts to arrive at the plengkung beach or you could walk for about 10km, i've seen some teenagers in group walking through the forrest.
Don,t complain about the road condition since the goverment will try to keep the part remain the same including the whole ecosystem from human interference.
Some advice : dont expect too much for the beach , it's not for kids or family visit, mostly for surfers. And ask the driver's mobile number  you need it to ensure when he will come back to pick you up.
There are some surfers camp you could rent for 450rb/person/night or 100$/Overseastourist/night.
Only mobile provider tel*omsel can reach this location :(

title: EXOTIC G-LAND
text: G-Land G-LAND One of those out of the way places known to locals , surfers and adventurers. Recent changes to the district government have seen a proactive approach to developing tourism and support of local businesses. Great beaches stretching around a cone shaped island. Quite a distance from POLUTIONS

title: amazing surf and setting
text: G-Land This is a truly amazing surf location and setting.  The national forrest is alive with animals that seem to have all but disappeared in other areas of Indonesia.  The monkey are definitely a little more wild than those you  come across at temples that attract the tourists.

title: Walking to G-Land
text:
G-Land The government has left Plengkung Beach (alias Grajagan alias G-Land) in Alas Purwo National Park to private enterprise.  Three surf camps (a fourth one went broke) accommodate surfers at inflated prices - typically USD 70 to 110 for full board - after they have been shipped over from Bali.  While we would not deny these surfers their favoured sport, we do regret that the accommodation for wildlife watchers at Trianggulasi has been discontinued by the authorities.
At early morning we walked the 9 km from the Pancur checkpoint to G-Land along the road close to the beach but mostly shaded by trees.  We were rewarded by the sounds of birds and the sight of a deer family crossing the road.  Of course there were monkeys in the trees too.  At some places one can take a dip in the sea, but later in the morning the water is too low for swimming.  The surfers too then come back to shore and wait for the next high tide in the afternoon.
When we walked back later in the day we were fortunate that Mr Giran's jungle taxi overtook us.  As his car was empty he let us hop on for Rp 25,000 p.p.  If you need transport to or from G-Land, call him at mobile 081 348 757 511.
Directions: From Genteng the distance to G-Land is about 57 km, from Banyuwangi it is perhaps 10 km more.  We followed signboards “Wisata Plengkung” which led us the border of the park near Tegaldlima village. But the ticket office is 10 km further south at Pasar Anyar, and from the barrier at Pancur you have to either walk the last 9 km (two hours) or take a jungle taxi (45 minutes, Rp 250,000 irrespective of the number of passengers).
Admission: At the ticket office we paid Rp 2,500 p.p. for admission, Rp 6,000 for our car and Rp 5,000 for bringing a camera.

title: G-Land for the Adventurous
text:
G-Land Although the road is mostly in a terrible condition, and taking a long time to get there (2 and a half hour to do 60 kms). I don't regret going there, through the orange groves, teak forests, etc.. until a parking area, where one has to go for a 4x4 vehicle ride through the final 5 kms stretch to one of the most beautiful white sanded beaches. Plengkung as it is known, has some of the best waves, attracting surfers from Kuta; who do the trip by fast boats.
One can see all sorts of animals in the forest from peacocks, to Deers, strange monkeys, Komodo-like lizzards, etc... Great place! but bring your own lunch, to have in one of the few spots prepared for the occasion. the few restaurants on the beach are very expensive...as deliveries are scarce and risky.
